the automaker's recovery plan after its 2009 bankruptcy filing and near-collapse. "2011 needs to be characterized as the year of execution," Chief Executive Sergio Marchionne told analysts and journalists during a conference call. We need to execute on what we promised to do. Chrysler, which is now 25 percent owned by Fiat, projected it will sell 2 million cars and trucks worldwide in 2011, up from a little more than 1.5 million in sales in 2010.
